databases.question: Which databases are supported?
databases.answer: Currently, DbTree supports PostgreSQL (version 9.6 and above). Support for other DBMS coming soon.

security.question: Is my data safe?
security.answer: Absolutely! DbTree works in read-only mode and stores no data. All connections are direct to your database.

platforms.question: Can I use it on Mac or Linux?
platforms.answer: The current version is optimized for Windows. Mac and Linux versions coming soon.

java.question: Do I need to install Java?
java.answer: No! The standalone version includes everything you need. Download and run, that's it.

trial.question: Can I try it for free?
trial.answer: Yes! Download the free trial version, no credit card required.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.intro: By using DbTree, you agree to the following terms and conditions. Please read them carefully before using the software.
terms.useContent: DbTree is a desktop application for visualizing relational databases. It is provided as-is for personal and professional use. You may not reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble the software.
terms.licenseContent: The Free plan grants a limited license to use DbTree with restricted features. The Pro and Lifetime plans grant a full license for unlimited use. Licenses are personal and non-transferable.
terms.limitationContent: DbTree operates in read-only mode and does not modify your databases. However, we are not responsible for any data loss, corruption, or damage that may occur from the use of the software.
terms.modificationContent: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of DbTree after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
terms.contactContent: For any questions regarding these terms, please contact us at contact.dbtree@gmail.com.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains how DbTree handles your information.
privacy.collectionContent: DbTree does not collect, store, or transmit any of your database data. All connections are made directly from your machine to your database server. We may collect anonymous usage statistics (feature usage, crash reports) to improve the software.
privacy.usageContent: Any anonymous data collected is used solely to improve DbTree's performance and features. We never sell or share your information with third parties.
privacy.storageContent: Database connection credentials are stored locally on your machine only. They are never transmitted to our servers.
privacy.rightsContent: You can delete all locally stored data at any time by uninstalling DbTree. If you have a Pro account, you can request deletion of your account data by contacting us.
privacy.contactContent: For privacy-related inquiries, reach us at contact.dbtree@gmail.com.

refund.title: Refund Policy
refund.intro: We want you to be satisfied with your purchase. Here is our refund policy.
refund.eligibilityContent: You may request a full refund within 14 days of your purchase if DbTree does not meet your expectations. This applies to both Pro monthly subscriptions and Lifetime licenses.
refund.processContent: To request a refund, send an email to contact.dbtree@gmail.com with your purchase details (order number, email used for purchase). Refunds are processed within 5-10 business days.
refund.exclusionsContent: Refunds are not available after 14 days from the purchase date. If you have already received a refund for a previous purchase, additional refund requests may be declined.
refund.contactContent: For refund requests, email us at contact.dbtree@gmail.com.
